page.title: 18HEALTH - Sister Dora Home.
page.content:
The Sister Dora home is at Milford, just off the road to Brocton.They look after people who are old and often disabled.The nurses wear uniforms like a state hospital.There are 36 staff including domestic and non domestic. They look after about 31 people from the local area and from anywhere in the country.They may stay for a short period to give relatives a break for two weeks to two months.Many are long stay patients and two have been there for 14 and 10 years. The place is named after Sister Dora who helped save many men in the Great War (1914-1918) at her hospital in Walsall.The building has also been used for miners with bad lungs and by the Royal Wolverhampton Hospital as a convalescent home.
(Tracey Marshall Age 11)
